page.title: 10Llandudno: Historical (2)
page.content: { The Chester to Holyhead railway}was built in 1848 with a{branch line to {Llandudno}in 1858. The first pier was constructed in 1858, but was destroyed by a severe storm a year later. The {present pier,}2,295 feet long and con- sidered to be one of the finest examples of a{typical Victorian pier, was built in 1876. In 1878 work was begun on a roadway, the{Marine Drive which now encircles the Gt.Orme. Llandudno is associated with the well-known story of{Alice in Wonder- {land,}to which the{White Rabbit statue on the West Shore bears witness. Alice Liddell, whose father was so fond of the area that he built a summer house in the town, inspired the Rev.C.L. Dodgson, better known as the author, {Lewis Carroll,}to produce his literary masterpiece.
